Supported systems: IBM® BladeCenter® HS12 Types 8014 and 8028

Follow the network operating system (NOS) installation instructions in this document in sequential order unless these instructions advise you otherwise. Windows and messages might differ from those in this document. Throughout this document, the term select is used to denote the use of arrow keys, the tab key, or Alt + a letter combination to make a selection from a menu. The term click is used to denote the use of a mouse to make a selection.

1.0 What you will need

Note:

In this document, the term "Windows® Server 2003" is sometimes used as a short form of "Microsoft® Windows Server 2003 RC2 Enterprise x64 Edition".

You must have the following software and hardware for the installation:

A licensed copy of Microsoft Windows Server 2003 x64 RC2.

Supported hard disk drives. Go to http://www.ibm.com/servers/eserver/serverproven/compat/us/ for the ServerProven® list of supported options and part numbers for the blade server.

Before you install Microsoft Windows Server 2003, you must download the 64-bit device driver for the LSI Logic Fusion - MPT SAS Driver (Server 2003 64-bit) controller.

For more information, see the documentation that comes with your BladeCenter unit.

2.0 Where to download device drivers and files

You can download device drivers and files from the following sites:

IBM U.S. Support Web site: http://www.ibm.com/support/

For countries outside the U.S., start at http://www.ibm.com/

For IBM BladeCenter device drivers and firmware, go to Software and device drivers.

For IBM BladeCenter product specifications, go to http://www.ibm.com/systems/bladecenter/ .

For IBM monitor specifications, go to http://www.ibm.com/systems/support/monitors/

3.0 Installation instructions for Microsoft Windows Server 2003 x64 RC2

To install Windows Server 2003 RC2 Enterprise x64 Edition, you must first create an LSI SAS 3000 Series Logic Fusion-MPT Adapter device driver diskette.

3.1 Creating an LSI SAS 3000 Series Logic Fusion-MPT Adapter device driver diskette

To create the LSI SAS 3000 Series Logic Fusion-MPT Adapter device driver diskette, complete the following steps:

From an Internet-connected system with a diskette drive, go to Software and device drivers.

Select the Blade Center Device Drivers Matrix.

In the Serial attached SCSI section, select the file link for IBM HS12.

Locate and download the 64-bit device driver for the LSI SAS 3000 Series Logic Fusion-MPT Adapter.

When the Terms and Conditions window opens, choose one of the following options:

Make sure that Use Download Director is selected (the default); then, select I agree. The .exe file will be saved to a location that you specify. When you are prompted to launch the file, select Yes, and then go to step 6.

Clear the Use Download Director box; then, select I agree. The File Download window opens. Click Save. The .exe file is saved to a local directory. Double-click the .exe file to run it.

When you are prompted, read the license agreement, select I accept the terms in the license agreement, and then click Next.

Insert a blank, formatted diskette in the diskette drive; then, click Next. The system extracts the device driver files to the diskette.

When you are prompted, click Finish.

3.2 Installing Microsoft Windows Server 2003 x64 RC2

To install Windows Server 2003 x64 RC2, complete the following steps:

Insert the Windows Server 2003 CD into the BladeCenter CD drive.

Press the media tray button on the front of the HS12 blade server to make sure that it is associated with the CD drive.

Press the video select button on the front of the HS12 blade server to make sure that it is associated with the keyboard/video/mouse (KVM).

Turn on the blade server.

When you are prompted with the message Press any key to boot from cd, press any key to start the blade server from the Windows Server 2003 Setup CD. Files are copied from the setup CD. This process takes a few minutes.

At the prompt Press F6 to add proprietary drivers, press F6.

When the Setup program pauses, click S to add a device driver from the diskette.

Insert the LSI Logic Fusion device driver diskette.

When the list of device drivers on the diskette is displayed, select LSI Logic Fusion -MPT SAS Driver (Server 2003 64-bit) from the list and press Enter.

When you are prompted to install Windows Server 2003, press Enter.

When the license agreement is displayed, read the license agreement, click Page Down to scroll to the bottom of the screen, and then press F8 to select I Agree.

When Windows Server 2003 Setup displays all hard disk storage that is available on the blade server, select one of the following options to choose or create a drive partition in which to install Windows Server 2003 x64 RC2:

Allow Setup to create a partition: To partition the entire hard disk as one primary partition, highlight Non-partitioned space for the hard disk drive on which you want to install Windows Server 2003 x64 RC2 and press Enter.

Create a partition: To create a partition, highlight Non-partitioned space for the hard disk drive on which you want to install Windows Server 2003 RC2, and click C. You are prompted to indicate how much available space to allocate from the nonpartitioned drive. Type the amount of space (in MB) and press Enter.

Delete a partition.

When you are prompted to select a file system, select NTFS file system.

Notes:

Setup formats the selected partition and copies the applicable files to the drive partition. This process takes several minutes.

The blade server restarts to the graphical portion of Setup where Setup continues with the installation of Windows Server 2003. During this process, Setup automatically installs and configures devices in the blade server. This process takes several minutes.

Change the regional settings if you are not installing the blade server in the U.S; then, click Next.

Note:

To modify the regional settings after installing Windows Server 2003, select Control Panel; then, select Regional Options.

In the Personalize Your Software window, when you are prompted for your name and organization, type your name in the Name field and type your organization in the Organization field. The names that you type are used as default blade server names. Applications that you install later use this information for the product registration and document identification. Click Next.

When you are prompted for the Windows Server 2003 Setup CD-Key, type the Windows Server 2003 Setup CD-Key in the applicable fields. Click Next. (The Setup program uses the organization name that was entered previously, as a suggested name for the blade server.)

In the Licensing Modes window, select the applicable licensing mode for your organization and click Next.

In the Name and Administrator Password window, when you are prompted for an administrator password and blade server name, type the blade server name and password; then, click Next. (The Setup program uses the organization name that was entered previously, as a suggested name for the blade server.)

Note:

Passwords are case sensitive. Be sure to use a combination of uppercase and lowercase letters with at least one number for your password.

In the Time Zone window, set the current time. To change the date, click the button to the right of the date. To change the time, highlight the value that you want to change and enter the new values using the keyboard or the Up Arrow and Down Arrow keys. Click Next.

Note:

Windows Server 2003 services perform many tasks that are dependent on the accuracy of the time and date settings of the blade server. Be sure to select the correct time zone for the blade server location to avoid problems.

In the Networking Settings window, select Typical or Custom settings. If you are prompted, type the applicable network information. Click Next to install Windows networking components.

Note:

If the network controller card is not functioning, which can happen with this blade server, you are not prompted for network information. You can set up the network from Windows after Windows Server 2003 is installed.

In the Workgroup or Computer Domain window, select one of the following options:

No, this computer is not on a network, it is a network without a domain.

Yes, make this computer a member of the following domain.

Type the workgroup or domain name in the applicable field and click Next.

The remaining operating-system components are installed and configured according to the options that you specified. The display in the left column shows the amount of time remaining until the Windows Server 2003 installation is completed. This process might take several minutes.

When Windows Server 2003 Setup has completed installation, the blade server automatically restarts.

After Windows Server 2003 restarts, press Ctrl+Alt+Delete to log on.

When the desktop is displayed, the Windows Server 2003 x64 RC2 secondary CD window is displayed. Place the second CD into the system and click Ok to enable Windows Server 2003 x64 RC2 to finish installing.

The Security Updates wizard begins. If this blade server is connected to the Internet, use this wizard to help you download software security updates and configure the system to retrieve updates automatically.

After closing the Security Updates wizard, the Manage Your Server wizard launches automatically. Use this wizard to help you to add and configure additional roles for the blade server, such as File Server, DHCP Server, Active Directory, and DNS. For more information, click Read about server roles in the wizard.

Note:

You can skip this step and launch the wizard later by clicking Start -> Settings -> Control Panel -> Administrative Tools -> Configure Your Server Wizard.

4.0 Post installation instructions: Installing and updating device drivers

After the installation is complete, to make sure that you have the latest device drivers and firmware for the BladeCenter unit and blade servers, follow the instructions in the readme.txt file included in the device driver package.

Use the procedures in the following sections to install the device drivers and to resolve any Unknown device.

4.1 BladeCenter Web site

To download the device driver and firmware packages and the installation instructions for the HS12 blade server, complete the following steps:

Go to Software and device drivers.

Under Related downloads, click BladeCenter.

Under Software and device drivers, select Create your dynamic matrix.

Select IBM BladeCenter HS12 and bookmark this site to check for periodic updates of device drivers and firmware files, such as BIOS, BMC, or Ethernet device firmware.

4.2 Installing an IBM system-board device driver

To install the IBM system board device drivers, complete the following steps:

Go to Software and device drivers.

Under Related downloads, click BladeCenter.

Under Software and device drivers, select Create your dynamic matrix.

Follow the menus for BladeCenter HS12 Type 8014 or Type 8028.

Locate and select the Intel Chipset Software Installation Utility; then, select the necessary file and use one of the following procedures:

Click Open to run the file from its location on the IBM Web site (preferred).

Transfer the file to a local drive, and then double-click the executable (exe) file to run it.

In the Welcome window, click Next.

In the License Agreement window, read the agreement and click Yes to agree.

At the Readme information, click Next.

After the device drivers are installed, click Finish.

4.3 Installing Broadcom Ethernet device drivers

To install the Broadcom NetXtreme Gigabit Ethernet device driver, complete the following steps:

Go to Software and device drivers.

Under Related downloads, click BladeCenter.

Under Software and device drivers, select Create your dynamic matrix.

Follow the menus for BladeCenter HS12 Type 8014 or Type 8028 for instructions to download the Broadcom NetXtreme Gigabit Ethernet device driver. This takes a few minutes.

Double-click the device driver package, which is an executable (.exe) file that will open an extraction program.

In the Welcome window, click Next.

In the License Agreement window, read the license agreement; then, click Accept.

Type c:\drivers\nic for the folder where the files are to be saved, and click Finish. Later, you will point to this location when installing the device drivers.

Click Yes.

When the message The package has been delivered successfully is displayed, click OK.

Navigate back to c:\drivers\nic and use either of the following procedures to install the device drivers.:

Run Setup.exe to install the device drivers.

Double-click the Launch icon to install the device drivers.

Refer to the readme file for installation instructions.

After the device drivers are installed, click Finish.

Follow the device driver readme file and the applicable Server 2003 installation documentation to configure the network to your specific needs after the correct network device drivers are installed

4.4 Installing the ATI ES1000 video device driver

To install the ATI ES1000 video device driver, complete the following steps:

Go to Software and device drivers.

Under Related downloads, click BladeCenter.

Under Software and device drivers, select Create your dynamic matrix.

Follow the menus for BladeCenter HS12 Type 8014 or 8028 to download the ATI video device driver.

Refer to the ATI video device driver readme file for the installation instructions.
